communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Visits
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I hope this request finds you in good spirits. I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be provided to me that pertains to all your facilities. 

I am requesting records for the time period of June 2023 to June 2024, by specific facility.

* Number of adult family/friend visitors per month and year.
* Number of visitor vehicle searches conducted on-site at facility, by month and year.
* Number of visitors whose visits were permanently restricted, by month of final determination by AWO.
* Number of visitors whose visits were temporarily restricted, and total length of restriction.
* Number of visitors who were issued a "warning" regarding their visitation privileges, by month and year.
* Number of video visits canceled by the facility (month and year). 
* How funds from video visits canceled by each facility were used, including total amounts and reason for use. By facility, by month, and by year. 

Please provide the records requested above for June 2023 to June 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Laurel King Russell

title: Illinois State Police - IDOC complaint investigations

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Illinois State Police - IDOC complaint investigations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I hope this request finds you in good spirits. I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be provided to me that pertains to your facilities:  

Please provide the records requested below for June 2023 to June 2024. 

* Number of IDOC complaints received by ISP (monthly and yearly).
* Type of IDOC complaints received by ISP (monthly and yearly).
* Resolution of IDOC complaints received by ISP (i.e., investigated, transferred). By type and category, both monthly and yearly.

Sincerely,

Laurel King Russell

communications.subject: Vermont Public Records Act Request: Presentation materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Vermont Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

While teaching a forensics class to high school 20 students in June, Burlington police officers staged a surprise demonstration in which a masked gunman burst into the room and pretended to open fire. 

Teachers said BPD officers told them that they'd previously used the lesson with college students and adults, and that they wanted the event to be “as realistic as possible.”

In its statement, the Burlington Police Department said school staff approved the demonstration’s content ahead of time and agreed to let parents and students know. The simulation would involve “fake firearms in a mock shooting,” the department said it wrote to school staff on May 23. 

I am looking for:

- planning documents, memos, emails or other communications about the planning of the described demonstration
- emails between the department and the school staff about the scheduled demonstration. Please include the May 23rd email to school staff 
- after action reports or communications within the department after the incident.
- surveillance footage of the incident or recordings of the incident

As required under the law, I request that the agency provide the above records in their native digital format, where applicable (such as a CSV, Excel, or other digital data format), and transferred to me electronically. If you deny this request in whole or in part, I request that you respond with the statutory exemption underlying the denial and the reasoning therein. If an asserted exemption applies to only a portion of a record, please delete or redact the portion to which the exemption applies and provide the remainder of the record, as required under the statute.
.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

Please provide records and answers for the time period of June 2022 to June 2024.

* Number of complaints regarding the Illinois Department of Corrections sent to your office (monthly and yearly).
* Number of complaints resolved in favor of constituents' requests (monthly and yearly).
* Number of complaints sent back to IDOC (monthly, yearly).
* Number of repeated complaints by a particular constituent (i.e., constituent A filed 27 complaints in 2023), according to month/year.
* Type of complaints submitted to your office, regarding the IDOC (i.e., staff, healthcare, grievances, excessive force).
* Outcome of IDOC complaints handled by your office.
* Length of time for resolution of IDOC complaints sent to your office.
* IDOC complaints by facility, including types (monthly, yearly).
* List of any outside agencies consulted or collaborated with in resolution of IDOC complaints, other than the governor's office or IDOC.
* Number of founded (valid) complaints against IDOC (monthly and yearly).
* Number of rejected (unfounded) complaints against IDOC (monthly and yearly).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Laurel King Russell

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Forms 3500/3500B
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Health professionals, consumers and patients can voluntarily report observed or suspected adverse events for human medical products to FDA.  Reporting can be done through our online reporting portal or by downloading, completing and then submitting FDA Form 3500 (Health Professional) or 3500B (Consumer/Patient) to MedWatch: The FDA Safety Information and Adverse Event Reporting Program. I am looking for:
- The current database schema, data dictionary, or other reference document(s) to show how the FDA tracks these reports.
 - A database export or disaggregated data of reports submitted to this system since 2020.  If possible please include accompanying documentation submitted by the complainant. Please include the relevant fields releasable under the law. 

As required under FOIA, I request that the agency provide the above records in their native digital format, where applicable (such as a CSV, Excel, or other digital data format), and transferred to me electronically. If you deny this request in whole or in part, I request that you respond with the statutory exemption underlying the denial and the reasoning therein. If an asserted exemption applies to only a portion of a record, please delete or redact the portion to which the exemption applies and provide the remainder of the record, as required under the FOIA. 

As a reporter for the WIRED, I qualify as a news media requester for the purpose of fees. See 5 U.S.C. 552(a)(4)(A)(ii). Further, because this request is being made for a journalistic purpose regarding a matter of public interest, I further ask that you waive any fees. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Request for documents pertaining to a 1984 CIA conference on Soviet Strategic Deception and a 1985 NIE (11-11) on the same topic. (Central Intelligence Agency)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1). Proceedings of the Central Intelligence Agency conference, "SOVIET DECEPTION OF US INTELLIGENCE: CONCEPTS TECHNIQUES AND PROSPECTS", held on 29-31 AUGUST 1984 at Airlie House, Warrenton Virginia, published internally by CIA/DI/Office of Global Issues.
- An "after-action report" on the conference prepared for DCI Casey by James B. Bruce (mentioned in declassified article from Studies in Intelligence Vol. 64, No. 1 (Extracts, March 2020).
- Any other documents (plans, reports, meetings, communications, discussions, etc) pertaining to the conference.
If either the conference proceedings or related documents are still classified, please process this as a Mandatory Declassification Review request.

2). The two-volume National Intelligence Estimate titled, "Soviet Strategic Deception" ("NIE 11-11"; "NIE 11-11-85"), prepared by the National Intelligence Council for the Reagan administration in 1985.
- Any other documents (plans, reports, meetings, communications, discussions, etc) pertaining to National Intelligence Estimate 11-11-85.
If either the NIE or related documents are still classified, please process this as a Mandatory Declassification Review request.

I am an international relations scholar working for a public research institution (Peace Research Institute Frankfurt), doing research into the history of intelligence and the problem of strategic deception. The material will exclusively be used for scholarly research.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Forsythe

title: ShotSpotter / SoundThinking Contract Expansion (Boston Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Documents, emails and text messages relating to the expiration of the current Boston municipal contract with ShotSpotter, other than the one email already supplied under PRR# B003003-092523.- 

- Any documents, emails or other materials referring to "Phase II" of the proposed contract with SoundThinking to provide ShotSpotter coverage in the areas of Dorchester, Roxbury and Mattapan, including any documents describing the basis on which the area to be covered by Phase II was determined.

- In Exhibit B of the current Service Level Agreement (which expires June 30), page 114, ShotSpotter (now rebranded as "SoundThinking") commits to detect at least "90% of unsuppressed, outdoor gunfire incidents, using standard, commercially available rounds above .25 caliber [...] Each Service Level measurement shall be determined quarterly, the results of which will be reviewed during the periodic account review meetings with Customer." We equest any records relating to these quarterly determinations or periodic account review meetings, and any information relating to adherence or non adherence to the contracted Service Levels, and any information as to how "gunfire incident" is defined." If there are no records of any such quarterly determinations or periodic account review meetings having happened, please specify that there are no responsive documents, rather than simply disregarding entirely this important element of the request.

- Any documents where ShotSpotter (now SoundThinking) and the City discuss an expansion of the contract to cover other services currently provided by SoundThinking. SoundThinking currently refers to four services - ShotSpotter, "CrimeTracer", "CaseBuilder" and "ResourceRouter", as their "SafetySmart" platform. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Best wishes
Alex.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

Sincerely,

Alex Marthews

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas State Employees (2013 - 2014)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Monthly electronic listings of all employees of the Arkansas Executive Branch from January 1, 2000 to December 31, 2012. Specifically, I am seeking electronic listings of all individuals employed within the offices of the Governor and Lieutenant Governor and all state agencies, commissions, and departments for each month from January 1, 2000 to December 31, 2012.

For each month, I’m seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following fields for each employee: 

Business Area Description
Personnel Area
Personnel Area Description
First Name	
[Middle] Initials
Last Name
Employment Percent
Part-time Employee
Employment Status
Gender
Ethnic Origin
Position title
Entry Date
Date of termination
Annual salary
Employee Group

Thank you for your continued time and assistance. I really appreciate it.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Ben Goehring.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: California State Employees (2010 - 2018)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello,

I am requesting monthly copies of all employees who work in the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation for each month from January 2010 through December 2018. In particular, I am requesting a single spreadsheet (with different sheets for each month) or a series of spreadsheets for each month with the following variables (where DEPARTMENT NAME == CDCR): 

DEPARTMENT NAME
FACILITY NAME
COUNTY NAME
LAST NAME	
FIRST NAME
INT INDICATOR
CLASSIFICATION TITLE
CLASS TYPE
CEA INDICATOR
TIME BASE
TENURE
SALARY PER
BASE SALARY
ON-LEAVE INDICATOR
UNIQUE IDENTIFIER
SAFETY MEMBER
OASDI
CBID

In addition, please include any lookup tables that may be needed to interpret the data. For example, if departments are listed with codes linked to a separate table, I will be happy to join the records myself, rather than require your staff to do so.

I am comfortable working with large data sets and can receive the records in a variety of formats (.dbf, .csv, .mdb, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Ben Goehring

communications.subject: PRA Request
communications.communication:
Mr. Goehring,


The State Controller's Office is in receipt of your attached Public Records Act request.  You requested employee data from January 2010 through December 2018.  We are able to provide the requested data from December 2010 through December 2018 at no cost in 4-5 weeks; however, the CBID field will not be on the report until October 2013.

If you need the data for January 2010 through November 2010, it would take 7-9 weeks, at an estimated cost of $1,810-$1,970, depending on the number of programming hours required.

Please let me know how you would like to proceed.

Thanks,


[cid:image001.png@01DAB7FC.22781E70]
Dave Brownfield | Staff Counsel
Office of State Controller Malia M. Cohen
300 Capitol Mall, Suite 1850
Sacramento, CA 95814 | 916-322-7535
